page.title: 15CRAMOND :Green Belt Golfing
page.content: 1985 is an important anniversary of the Royal Burgess Golf Club which was laid out by locals in 1735 where there once had been beautifual parkland surrounded by mature trees. Recently the course was improved by James Braid who twice won the British Open Championship. There are more than 1000 members, including about 50 juniors. The Pro since 1973 has been George Yuille. The Club has a Pro Shop. Inside the clubhouse there is a diningroom, a bar, a television room and a billiard room, and strangely enough a card room. There are lockers and showers. The Royal Burgess runs alongside the Bruntsfield Links Golf Club. On the Dalmeny Estate side of the River Almond there is the Earl of Rosebery's private course of nine holes. These courses are all within the Green Belt.
